subject: Economics
title: Nuclear Deterrence: Game Theory Saves the World
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Nuclear Deterrence: Game Theory Saves the World.

hook.text: The Cold War lasted 45 years with 70,000 nuclear weapons and zero nuclear wars.

buildup.text: MAD: if either side launches, both are destroyed.

discovery.text: RAND Corporation strategists like Thomas Schelling applied game theory to nuclear strategy.

twist.text: MAD required both sides to remain vulnerable.

climax.text: Nuclear deterrence is the highest-stakes game theory application in history.

punchline.text: The world survived the Cold War because two superpowers understood game theory.

quiz.question: Why would missile defense systems destabilize nuclear deterrence?
options: They could make a first strike survivable, removing the 'mutually assured destruction' that prevents nuclear war
